Reviews.Title: “Never endured such horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Rashel R
Reviews.Content: During January 2012 my friend and I traveled to Rome during a study abroad program. We booked Hotel Acropoli MONTHS in advance. Upon arrival after a 2 hour train ride from Florence we were told that the hotel had "overbooked" and we would be taken to another Hotel Acropoli in the same location close to the termini. We were taken to a hostel that was attempted to be covered up by a bed and breakfast sign (A casa di Jasmine) which was horrible. They would not refund our money or get us a room at Hotel Acropoli. I've never been treated like this and I never will again. Disgusting, ruined my view of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline P
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to say, that this is a very serious review. I stayed on the hotel for five days and I was very dissapointed. On the first day, our shower broke and we told the hotel immediately, but it was never fixed. We were forced to borrow showers on the other rooms, because the shower on the hall was terrible. The street was filled with hookers at night and some quite scary types at all hours. The included breakfast was extremely dry bread and pre-toasted toast. THE CLEANING LADIES STEALS FROM THE ROOMS, AND THE STAFF DOESN'T CARE. The hotel rooms are tiny and dirty. I only have one advice - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No words..”
Reviews.Author: Mamunka
Reviews.Content: I have no words, simply disguising...rooms are gruesome, service is appalling, way over priced, would not pay a cent to sleep here again. Thank god it was just for a quick sleep over before early train to Naples...nightmare!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation but helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: IanH174
Reviews.Content: While other visitors have found a lot to complain about, in our experience the hotel accommodation basic but clean, and the staff friendly and helpful. In particular, one of our party left behind a jacket. On return to the UK we contacted the reception, who found the jacket –it would have been easy not to– and went out their way to aid its collection and return. Providing one's expectations are not too high, it's pretty cheap after all, this is a reasonable place to stay and a good base for exploring the delights of Rome. IH

Reviews.Title: “What a D-U-M-P!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cheltbird
Reviews.Content: Where to start! This hotel (if you can call it that) is a JOKE! 4 of us (women) Booked through Thomas cook, we were told the hotel was 2 stars and it looked nice! On arrival the staff were very rude and unhelpful! We got given room '206' which was on the 2nd floor. When walking up to our room the hotel looked like a building site, walls were falling apart, random materials lying around and workmen all over the place. Bits of carpet sticking up every where-one on our corridor which i actually tripped and fell over on the second day! When opening the door to our room we were in shock! Four single beds crammed in to the smallest space imaginable! The beds were hard and uncomfortable with random stains on the sheets and some of the pillows. There were random white stains all over the floor too. Only one of the wall lights worked and it was hanging off-not exactly safe! There was chunks of flakey paint all over the floor as it was crumbling from the ceiling, you would expect this to at least be hoovered and cleaned up before new guests arrive!! The bathroom was worst of all! It was tiny and the stench in there was horrendous, smelt like someone had died in there! The sink was covered in hairs and filthy before we had even used it! Shower was tiny, freezing cold and the water leaked all over the bathroom floor! There was no cupboard space, just one wardrobe between all 4 of us and it only had one coat hanger in! We had one small bathroom mirror to share between four girls which was a nuisance when trying to get ready! The door to our room also didn't shut properly, you had to actually keep it locked with the key just to shut it and even then it wasn't very secure-could easily be forced open! The room was also freezing, it had one tiny radiator by the front door and there was a terrible draft coming in from the window, and of course-no spare blankets! Breakfast was included in the price which we thought was great until we tried it on the first morning! It simply consisted of a hot drink (crappy tasting coffee or tea) and a stale rock hard bread roll with a choice of choc spread or jam! To top all of this off, when packing up to leave the room on our last day we realized £100 had been stolen from one of our purses out of our hand luggage (no safe etc was provided to keep valuables in). Very upset and angry, we approached the reception to explain what had happened and they couldn't care less! We got no apology, they simply asked the cleaning staff about it and they said nothing-of course you're not going to admit to stealing money from a customer are you!!! I can't even understand what they were doing in our room when we weren't there as it certainly wasn't ever cleaned, all they did was leave one fresh towel on one of our beds and that was it! This was such a shame as Rome was such a beautiful lovely place and we found everyone else to be polite and friendly. I have stayed in far better accommodation for a lot less! I am not fussy and am quite happy to stay in basic accommodation but it should at least be clean and tidy on arrival and you certainly don't expect to have your valuables stolen! All i can say is it's lucky the rest of us didn't leave any money in the room as I'm sure they would have taken that too! Do yourself a big favor and stay in ANY other hotel than The Acropolis as it really was the worst hotel I have ever seen and stayed in. In my opinion it's not fit to be open to the public, especially rated at 2 stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotel In ROME - Hotel Acropoli”
Reviews.Author: sandra N
Reviews.Content: • The booking was for a double bed and we were assigned a room with five beds • When the receptionist changed us to another bedroom, it was in the same conditions but with four single beds • I told the receptionist that the room had nothing to do with what was advised by Hotel Reservation staff at the airport in rome. • As these were stained walls, bad lighting, bad smell in room and bathroom and he said bluntly that it was all we have take or leave it. • At the left side of Acropoli, there is another hotel that is 2 stars, I guess corresponded those rooms, if sent to through the front door that is on the left of the reception, I think awaiting them the same • The room smelled like an ashtray even though I requested for a smoke free room. • The entire place looks rundown, worn-out and in very poor maintenance conditions. • Suppose to have wireless internet in the room, but it only works in the lobby • I do not recommend unless you enjoy sleeping on a trash can! • You can even invite a prostitute through the window without even leaving your room. • The groups of shady characters made it scary to walk the street after dark. • This HOTEL probably be the worst hotel in ROME and under HOTEL RESERVATION LIST at the Airport and BOOKING.Com * Never recommend anyone to book through HOTEL RESERVATION Desk at the Airport in Rome, they cheat people by lying. • Shame! And, once you make the booking, through Hotel Reservation Desk at the Rome Airport it seems your money is gone. • The walls are crumbling, the dirt is everywhere an terrible cesspool smell lingers all over the hotel. There are no better and worse rooms in that place . All of them are a dump. * The owner hasn't spent a dime for renovations as the "hotel" relies mainly on school kids. • The hotel should have been closed down a long time ago as it is unfit for the human habitation and crates a health hazard. • Also, the Hotel Reservation desk at the airport should remove this dump from it's list and refund the money to the customers that booked this cesspool Beware of Hotel Reservation Desk at Rome Airport. do not make any reservation thru them. Hotel Reservation Desk informed us that the cost for the Double occupancy is Euro 37 per night. Booked room for 2 nights and did not realise what we were getting into. We paid Euro 60 (out of total cost of euro 74) and the lady informed that upon check out I need to pay the balance of AED 14 for 2 nights at the Hotel. There was something fishy. Upon check-in the room was not upto the mark as listed above so we refused to spend the night. Approached the Hotel Reservation Desk near Termini Station for a refund or another hotel and the Lady at the desk said we can re-book in another hotel but we cannot waive of the Booking cost (its not refundable - so we lost Euro 60) SO IN SIMPLE THE COST OF THE HOTEL IS EURO 7 PER NITE FOR THE ROOM and NOT EURO 37 as stated. EURO 30 is thier Booking charges. This clearly shows how the Hotel Reservation Desk at Rome Airport fleece you. Please note I just reviewed the Hotel details on the website for curiosity, if you review the hotel details online: The images that appear on the site does not correspond to those that were assigned in reality when we arrived in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “HotHELL aCRAPoli”
Reviews.Author: Rosselliot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just SO hard to explain...so I'll just tell you a little 'bout it. Some people say cold showers are refreshing, at this hotel, that will be your only option. If you love the sound of car-washes, you'll enjoy said sound every time any room touching yours flushes the toilet. Our room had the added feature of in-room snacks - - - smeared into the carpet. The beds left much to be desired, as did the slightly scary and not-at-all-confidence-inspiring neighborhood around Termini Station. During your stay, if you're in search for a more private room by the hourly rate, "Hotel Champagne Palace" (actual name...not joking) is right across the street and I imagine they would be quite accommodating. I never left valuables in the room, but I did overhear a lady loudly "discussing" with the front desk that one of the cleaning crew had taken it upon himself to permanently borrow €70 she had left in her luggage. Free wifi? HA! wifi, period?! HAHAHAHHAH! right. Well, we paid €100/night for one room w/ three people, and that was about €90 too much for this Hell hole. If you're looking at it purely from a "we didn't get murdered" standpoint, this hotel is worth 5 stars...from any other standpoint and it's hardly worth one.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT VISIT - CLEANING PERSONEL STEAL”
Reviews.Author: Mads B
Reviews.Content: DO NOT VISIT HOTEL ACROPOLI. My sister went there with her school and the room cleaners stole her money and went through her personal belongings, looking for more to steal. Absolutely pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “it was "ok"”
Reviews.Author: maboyali
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel before reading reviews so was apprehensive of what hotel would be like. Our visit was not as bad as others, Hotel in bad need of a refurbish.... Room -small.. 2 beds pushed together..sheets /pillows nice and clean.and comfortable..only one electrical socket so either fan, phone or camera on at a time...toilet/ bidet / washhand basin and shower in a 8ft by 3ft bathroom...clean with no mould etc...stains on carpet and walls not seriously dirty.. room at back of Hotel quiet but don't expect a view...poor lighting at night.one ceiling light not bright enough to read by. Reception ok friendly receptionists..corridors had holes in floor under carpet.. Tiny lift for 4 people which had a different covering on floor every day..to be fair there seemed to be some building work going on at top of building so probably the cardboard etc was an attempt to keep lift "clean" Breakfast ..roll and jam and coffee...fine Allowed to leave baggage in breakfast room until afternoon on checkout day. Anyway to sum up.....Forget the condition of Hotel get out into the beautiful city of Rome..see the sights...get tired .. enjoy the holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Cracker_Chris
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with 3 other friends for 10 nights (20th-30th July). We're all in our early 20s and found the hotel to be suitable to our needs, but definitely wouldn't recommend it if you are looking to book with a family or more than 2-3 nights. I'll break down this review for easier reading. It is a long review, so be warned. The information that is presented might prove to your advantage, however. First Impression The first impression of the hotel is that it is located on a side street amidst a number of restaurants, internet cafes, take-aways and other hotels. The street itself is just like any other regular street you'd find, except that during the night time it becomes exceptionally noisy (if you happen to have a room which faces this street) due to the restaurant and roads being busy). The reception is clean enough and has a nice vaulted ceiling, giving a good first impression, but the rest of the hotel isn't as inviting. The Acropoli Hotel is also adjoined to another hotel named Hotel Georgina which resides within the top 2 floors of the 5 story building. Rooms Our room was very basic and consisted of 4 beds, 2 bedside cabinets, 1 table, a chair, a shower and a ceiling fan. We expected this for the price and it being a 2 star hotel, but what we didn't expect was the decor of the room and the quality of the bedding etc. The walls are a dirty white and have marks on them, which could possibly have been made from people putting their feet on the wall whilst laying in bed etc. It wasn't very clean, and looked quite tatty. The mattress on the beds are, I can only describe as, very thick foam and not very comfortable at all. The pillows are also very thin and not very comfortable either. One of my friends staying in the room did ask for an extra pillow and was given one, but when another friend asked he was turned away at reception. The room included 2 European plug sockets which we used quite a lot to charge our iPods and phones. There isn't any TVs but that didn't bother us much. The shower in the morning was refreshing but the bathroom layout is something to be desired. The shower faces the toilet, and sprays over the toilet roll holder which can be a problem but as long as the toilet cover is down and the toilet roll is withdrawn into the holder, it's fine. The lack of a matt on the floor meant that the tiling become incredibly slippy after the shower as well, so take care and put a used towel on the floor. The shower itself was refreshing and hot water wasn't a problem. Location The location of the hotel is quite good and is only a couple of minutes walk away from Termini station, which was the main reason we chose the hotel in the first place. It's also a 2 minute walk in the other direction to the biggest church devouted to the Virgin Mary (Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore), plus other sites such as the Spanish Steps are in easy walking distance. Next to the Santa Maria Maggiore there is also a fountain which we used every day to refill water bottles. There are many take-aways, internet points, a launderette, a supermarket and a couple of restaurants right on the doorstep of the hotel. We found the take-aways closer to Termini station to be better, but stayed away from them when we could. The supermarket offers a lot of variety, including fresh bread, fruit and a lot of things that we used to make our own meals. The two restaurants directly adjacent to the hotel were buzzing after about 6pm every night and they stay open most nights until around 2am. We found this to be a bit of a nuisance since we had to keep the window open at night time due to the heat, and the noise was sometimes unbearable (including the noise of the roads). We also saw a lot of street peddlers trying to sell their wares to people sitting outside to eat, and there was many people playing instruments and then asking for money. Beware, the area seems to crawl with these people after dark. We also saw at least 3 prositutes taking clients into the hotel opposite as well, but thankfully never saw any enter our hotel. Staff The female receptionists at the hotel are very friendly, but the male ones are not. The males are usually on the desk at night time and seemed to have contempt for us for no apparent reason. As said, the females were very friendly. The cleaning staff seemed to clean our rooms after breakfast (the cleaning staff also serve breakfast) and on the first floor our room was done between 9-10am. Breakfast itself is served 7:30-9:30am, consisting of a bread roll, french bread (in packets, like crispy little slices of toast), chocolate and a fruit spread. A choice of water, coffee, tea and hot chocolate are available. There is no juice choices. The cleaners bring fresh towels each morning but only change bedding if you take it off the bed and throw it on the floor, otherwise they just remake the bed. Services The hotel did offer free wi-fi when we first arrived but within a day of us having access to it, the password was changed. When we asked them about it, they just said the wi-fi was for the office only which struck us as strange. Nevertheless, we didn't get to use it again and the hotel doesn't offer standalone PCs to connect to the internet either. It isn't much of a problem, there's plenty of internet cafes around the hotel. The problem with the cafes, however, is that they tend to be filled with the street peddlers that sell their goods and thus it's not a very clean environment (I'm writing from one now). Overall Overall I would give the hotel a 1/5. For staying in the hotel to sleep it does its job, providing a bed and safe enough area to store your things and rest, but for anything more it's better off looking elsewhere. I wouldn't recommend this place for a stay longer than 3 nights, and definitely not if you're travelling with family or are hoping for a romantic getaway. Spend a bit more, you'll thank yourself for it. As with a lot of the other reviews, the only thing this place has going for it is the location and (maybe) the price. We got the hotel at a relatively cheap price but for 10 nights, staying here was a major drag. It's just lucky we are young lads and had each others company and we out and about a lot, otherwise it would've been a whole other story. Any way, I hope you find this review helpful. I've been as honest as I can, and everything said isn't biased because I'm a snob etc. Just giving my opinion on the hotel, and I would stay here again but not for more than 3 nights. As said in the title, don't expect any thrills and you won't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan186338
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner just arrived back yesterday from a four night stay in this hotel. When we first arrived in Rome, we were very happy to find that there was a coach service which took us straight from Ciampino airport to Termini station. The coach company was called Terravision and only charged us 4 Euros per person for the trip. Once we had got off the coach, we used our map to find the way to the hotel which was only 2 roads and a 2 minute walk away. We found it very easily. Upon arriving, we checked in easily and quickly by providing proof of our reservation and our passports for their records (they gave them straight back!) and went up to our room. It was on the first floor and the first room. We did use the lift which was a bit scary as it didn't seem too secure but we found this quite funny. The room was very basic. Two single beds disguised as one, a wardrobe, a table and a small bathroom with a built in shower. It wasn't the cleanest of all rooms and there was some hair left in the bathroom but it was as we expected with the price paid. There isn't any air conditioning which we knew before we had booked it after doing some research. It was very hot due to it being the summer season but we went out and got a fan from a local shop on our first night for 21 Euros and this lasted through the holiday. The location is perfect for seeing Rome. The Colosseum was within a twenty minute walk as well as the Fountain Di Trevi and the Spanish Steps. The Vatican was a bit further out but we reached it easily by getting a tube from Termini station. It was only five stops on the Metro line with a ticket costing only 1 Euro! (A big surprise to us being Londoners). There are a lot of restaurants nearby which cater for all tastes at quite reasonable prices. There is an ice cream shop across the road, two internet/phone shops and a launderette. There is also a sex shop across the road which is within view but not so obvious as to make it something that the kids would pick up on. Breakfast is served in the morning between 7.30 and 9.30. We only had this once as it was a bit early for us and it's as basic as you can get. Two bits of freeze dried bread and some rolls with an option of butter, jam or nutella. Not the worst thing in the world if you need something to eat but you wouldn't choose it over the options provided by the local restaurants. You do need to hand your keys into reception when you go out which did strike us as a bit strange and we tried to avoid doing it if possible by walking out without the receptionist spotting us. And there are also a lot of school groups as this seems to be their main choice of hotel. They can be loud and there were often a lot of kids hanging around in the hallways but it is something that comes with the price you pay and fortunately, whilst we were there, there were no particularly loud groups that went on through the night. We were also on the back part of the hotel, away from the main street, so i'm sure we avoided a lot of the noise. The beds were quite comfortable with decent sheets, blankets and pillows. The undersheet didn't seem to be changed every day but i can't be certain. There were fresh towels provided everyday. All in all, we were both very happy with our stay and believed it deserved a better review than the ones it has been given. Yes, it is one of the most basic hotels you will find but this is reflected in the price. If you want a short trip in Rome close to all the sites and the local transport then i would definitely recommend this hotel. Just make sure you bring a fan! Please feel free to contact me should you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “never ever go to this hotel for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: s4u
Reviews.Content: hi..i have stayed on this hotel for one night at the price of 60 euro,after i check in the room was in bad condition,we cannot lock the door properly from inside as we cannot sleep safe,three to four beds in the congested room. After when i going to sleep after nine o`clock,becoz i have flight early morning,the circumstances totally changed of the hotel,as there is party of school boys and girls started,boys and girls screaming on each other in very loud voices,how i can sleep there anyone can imagine,and check out the same time,as the man on the reception pretending that he didn`t understand what i am saying as he didn`t know whats running on his hotel,this is the worse experience of my life.never ever stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place for your money”
Reviews.Author: ZZ007
Reviews.Content: This is our worst hotel during our whole trip and the most expensive. You can do much, much better for your money, even in Rome. Try a hotel near the Republica. It's still within walking distance to the termini or 1 metro stop away and offers much better neighborhood, service and room. DO NOT come here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in another hotel..”
Reviews.Author: shihtzubears
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was its central location and proximity toTermini rail station.The hotel reception actually serves 2 hotels although it is all in the same building, confusing? Yes. The building is very run down and although the receptionist was cghatty the rest of the staff were definately as gloomy as the surroundings. The room we had was like an Iraqi detention centre and was very depressing from the minute you opened the creaky door, the so called shower and toilet was an ordeal to use and there was an awful smell in the room but when the window was opened for fresh air behind the musty curtains, which were straight out of Miss Havershams room in Great Expectation, there wasn't much improvement. The hotel was noisy most of the night with groups of kids running up and down the stairway and banging doors as they arrived back from their evenings adventures. I came to see ancient Rome but didnt expect an ancient hotel room, this place has not been done up since the 60s or 70s at best and requires a total refurbishment. The breakfast was very rudimentary and the windowless dining room even more so. This so called hotel is just a complete rip off and is best avoided at all costs, it spoiled our stay in this beautiful city even though it was for our final night, if you dont want nightmares..avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasticoooo Location!”
Reviews.Author: boyandnan
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend in our Mid Twenty's stayed here for 3 nights in February. After reading the reviews i was abit scared to say the lease. On arrival into the termini station we asked someone for direction and was glad to find it was like a 2 minute walk! Fantastic! We could not check in until 1pm so grabbed a drink at a nearby cafe. When we checked in the receptionist was lovely and friendly, we got to know her well and she looked after us and was very helpful! Her name was Elizabeta. When we checked in we got room 211. So 2nd floor. The lift smelt so bad i was nearly sick, my friend was laughing so much she fell up the stairs! We opted for the stairs. The room on approach was abit of an eye opening but it smelt clean and we had 3 beds so we put all our clothes on the third bed! The bathroom was abit old but it was clean and the only downer on any of the room was the bad light, it was aweful and there wasnt a mirror only in the bathroom, me and my friend found it hard having to share it all the time! The carpet needed abit of a clean, when we would use the shower i was having to put my shoes on, scared of what we would pick up on our feet!! We had some lovely meals at restaurants near the hotel and went to some lovely bars! The main reason for hotel was location, ive stayed in worse. It did exactly what it said on the tin and after paying £39 for 3 nights was not really bothered! Just get a good light and an extra mirror and it would of done the job for two ladys! We did meet the fat cleaner on the last day. She was lovely ( not ) !! We were laughing at her so much i think we scared her away! She chucked us out of reception as she was cleaning and she said we was in the way, we wasnt think she just didnt like us as we stood upto her and we were english - very loud and giggling ha ha!! Made me laugh at least! If you want a hotel near to everything and nice restaurants and bars nearby then this is the hotel for you! If you want luxury then dont!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the fat cleaning lady”
Reviews.Author: pete01962
Reviews.Content: The hotel has polite and helpful front desk staff but the FAT cleaning lady is VERY RUDE. She needs to attend training in politeness. She should not be working where there are tourist, it makes bad impression on the place itself.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: sharong73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels throughout Europe and this one was average. It seems to have improved since last year (judging from previous reviews). The room was small, we had two twin beds put together to make a queen size bed, and a third twin bed on the side, which was great to lay out clothes and not have them crammed in my suitcase. There were no tv, radio, nor phone, but all that was a plus for me and my husband as we had time to talk to each other and enjoy each other's company. We were in the room only to rest and sleep, which became hard to do once teenage groups came to stay. It sounded like they were throwing each other against the walls! Running in hallways, screaming, and slamming doors. I tried to be patient considering it might be the first time they were ever out of their homes, but I did mention it to the front desk. They said they would talk to the teachers. I never travel without my earplugs, which helped a great deal. The noise level seems to be an issue throughout Europe, at least for me, so I knew what to expect. Also, I figured if we were getting a low cost hotel, we had to expect things like this. The cleanliness of the room was acceptable, we got clean towels everyday and when we asked for more, the only person at the front desk gave us the keys to the storage, so we could also get toilet paper. We also had plenty of blankets and pillows, and the drapes in the window were nice. The window was also new. There were two mirrors, one in the bathroom and the other outside the bathroom. We had 4 electrical outlets, and plenty of lights. The bathroom was small, with the toilet paper dispenser directly under the shower!! hahahaha Somehow the paper stayed dry! At least there was a shower curtain and hot water with a nice pressure, unlike other Rome hotels I've stayed at! The bathroom was clean, in good working order. The floors did get very wet after a shower, but they were not slippery and the bathroom was very clean every day when we came back after sightseeing. Security?? Questionable. We checked in and then left for dinner, and we had to leave the keys at the front desk. Later we returned and asked for our key, and the new attendant didn't ask for our ID or anything, she just handed us the keys. It would take someone very little effort to observe when you come and go, then ask for your key and have a ball in your room with your valuables!! By the way, our valuables were always safe. Breakfast is very basic: a piece of bread, two toasts, jam, butter, and nutella. Coffee, chocolate or tea and that is all you need to get you going on your day's adventure and eat and drink yummier things out and about! The best thing about the hotel was its location. 2 block walk to the Termini station, where the train from the airports ends its route, and where you can take 2 metro lines and many buses. Termini station is also great for shopping and dining at every budget. There are many places to eat around the hotel, including a place across the street where they have a nice variety of gelattos. There are a couple of nice pubs within a 4 block walk from the hotel and walking late at night was very safe. The street where the hotel is located was shut down due to construction, so there was minimal noise. The staff at this place was friendly and I will definitely pay less to stay at this hotel than to stay at a 4 star hotel (by US standards) where I'm going to give away the money I could be spending on food, sightseeing and souveniers.

Reviews.Title: “Third class hotel”
Reviews.Author: suvi_15
Reviews.Content: Staying on railway platform is much better than staying in this hotel. We tarvel a lot but never stayed in any hotel worse than this. This hotel is only meant for drunkards (especially teenagers) who want to get drunk the whole night and make noise. Our stay option was with "cold breakfast". Never seen in our lifr more cold breakfast than this, The kitchen incharge keeps the bread and other items like butter /jam on each of the table of dining room before closing the kitchen earllier night. The bread is not even covered, The same thing has to be eaten by the guests which is fit to throw only to the dogs/beggers. So friends , please don't choose this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average rooms/service”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav_masand
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome for 2 days and our agent booked this hotel for 2 nights as other hotels were not available. Frankly, I just liked the location of the Hotel. The rooms very not well lit and not much tidy.The price is also very less though. If you are looking for a place just to sleep , close to the main metro ,thats it. You would not like to spend any more time in the rooms..

Reviews.Title: “not a Luxurious stay but you can prepare yourself to afford that for a certain time”
Reviews.Author: abdelya
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location in the center of Rome, i used to walk everyday to take breakfast in front of the colosseo, it takes 10 minutes walking to be there, a lot of buses you can take from everywhere around the hotel, but if you are planning to go, please put in mind not to stay for long time in the hotel because being in the street or using the toilet of any bar or a restaurant in the street will be better than using your own bathroom in the hotel...breakfast is served in rounds.. you have to wait outside for the next round..i used to have no hot water in my toilet and i was freezing...FOR GIRLS THERE IS NO MIRROR TAKECARE!!! THAT ANNOYED ME A LOT

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roweCambridge
Reviews.Content: this trip was a present for my daughters 21st birthday. We also had a 19month old baby along for the ride at the hotel from hell!! On arrival we had to wait for the 2 rooms to be cleaned, so we sat in reception with the not so smiley receptionist.. Both rooms were full of beds. 4 beds in one room and 3 in another. Although the linen was clean it didnt feel clean. The bathroom smelt foul. Reception staff smoking in reception. breakfast!!!!! my husband was waiting for more food until i told him that the bread roll and packet of small french toast was it! Fire safety- well in both rooms and all communal areas i could see all smoke detectors had been removed, never mind see a fire exit!!!!Now thats health and safety gone mad! very dissapointed that a large tour operator can provide this hotel. Cast a shadow over what a fabulous city rome is.

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds, worse breakfast and a broken toilet to finish it off.”
Reviews.Author: W_J_V
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in 2007, on my first visit to Rome. The receptionist wasn't too friendly, but I found the old stairs and elevator beautiful. Not too sure if the elevator is to be trusted though, it dangerously shaked and made odd noises at times. There was a beat up closet in our room and some of the lamps were broken. The bathroom is on another level and there is a pitiful excuse for a shower in there. We had a friend with us who is just over 2 metres and he had a hard time trying to catch some water in there. The showerhead is terrible indeed. The toilet is fine as long as you only take a pee in there, but we will get to that later. The street the hotel is on is very noisy, and one night, at around 3 AM, we heard terrible screams from a woman as if she was being killed. This lasted for about 30 minutes, then we heard her boyfriend or husband comforting her in English. She probably got lost, and this is a bad area to get lost in. Also saw a guy jacking off in plain daylight a few times. Must be one of the town idiots. There is a curfew. You can try to sneak in through the hotel next door which is connected, try not to get caught. They will give you some problems. We went down to have breakfast on the very first morning but quickly realized we had made a mistake. We nicknamed the 'breakfast', a brickfast. Everything you got was a loaf of bread which was hard as rock and you could easily break your teeth on. It came with a little package of disgusting crackers and some jam. So if you do decide to stay at this hotel, steer away from the breakfast. It really is terrible. One of the beds was broken and had a big dent in the middle. Might be comfortable for a dog or a cat, but not for a human. We had to use our own towels as they would not refresh them. The beds were cleaned daily, however. One time the hotel staff came knocking on our door, saying we had to stop throwing beer bottles and other stuff out of the window. Was quite appalled they said and maintained we did this. I do not know who it was, but it was not us. I told them this, and they got angry with me and wanted to kick us out. In the end I managed to calm them down, but every single time we passed the clerk we were greeted with suspicion and hatred. Right. Now for the problems we experienced with the toilet in our room. After 4 or 5 days, it broke. The water and anything in it would stay in the bowl and the toilet wouldn't properly flush. This all happened after a friend did his business there. Surely, he laid a right big coconut in there, but on a regular toilet it should just flush. This is not what happened to us there. It stuck. It took about an hour to get it to go down the drain, all the while severely testing my abdominal muscles as I was laughing so hard at the other fellow's misfortune. When the thing finally cleared the toilet and was out of our sight we thought everything was fine. But thereafter, everytime somebody flushed the toilet, the water crept higher and higher, with the water eventually being just a few centimetres below the seat. Remnant of human fecal matter and toilet paper floated in there, as if it was an aquarium. The smell was very disgusting, and everyone who has business in the bathroom would pinch their noses as to not smell the horrible odor in there. To make sure it did not enter the rest of the room, we laid wet towels under the bathroom door. The horror culminated in the very last hour of our stay there. We had already packed our suitcases and were about to return to the Netherlands, when I decided to take a pee. Apparently, my friends shouted at me and warned me not to flush, but I did not hear a thing. So I stood there, unzipped my trousers relieved myself in that open sewer that called itself a toilet. I flushed and casually turned around to walk back into the room, when suddenly I heard a noise which was a mix between a whale spout and a waterfall. I turned around and saw the toilet literally spitting out water and overflowing as if it was alive and being shot at. We quickly gathered up the last of our towels and barricaded the water and everything that was in it from entering our room. We opened the door one last time and the bathroom looked like a warzone. If you see this hotel, turn around and run. Very fast. Do not look back.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole- Provided a few laughs in low moments tho”
Reviews.Author: MancLad99
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for the Champions League final and on top of being situated in an area which is mainly a FC Roma area of town (and hence any English man should watch his back as we found out after a few angry Roma fans took exception to our Englishness and our football shirts) the hotel itself was shockingly bad. Cant stand up in the toilet, dirty and no aircon made for an uncomfortable stay. I advise being drunk most of the time you are in ur room as we were or it will not be tolerable!!!

Reviews.Title: “beeten up”
Reviews.Author: 123456789t
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this Hotel Acropoli or the one connected to it called the hotel Giorgina i got beat up here by the night porter from thehotel Giorgina because i asked about the broken vending machines

Reviews.Title: “Poor Excuse for a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyArctic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a complete dump. Before I list the things that were wrong, I am a well-travelled woman (I've stayed all throughout Central America, Asia, North America and Europe in a wide range of hotels, hostels and homes) and this is the first time I have ever been so appaulled by a place to write a review. THE GOOD - Upon arriving there, it was only 5 minute walk away from the train station and metro, my boyfriend and I noticed that there was construction all on the outer face of the hotel. It is in a fairly loud neighbourhood as it is and at first we just figured that it would help keep us out of the hotel room for as long as possible. The receptionist at first was very kind and as we got our key for our room I noticed that it looked like there were only 3 or so other rooms being rented at the time. THE BAD - We then crammed our luggage into the elevator (which was very unstable and shook as we went to the second floor) and walked along the hallway to our room. We at first couldn't even open our door as the key was faulty and had to be pryed into the keyhole to work. The door did not close properly and seemed to be warped and could be easily broken. At first look of our room we noticed they stuffed 4 beds into our one room (we were told we got a double room) and the room seemed to be not very clean. The room was actually not even level... either the room wasn't or the bathroom, I still am not sure which one it was. The bathroom which "has a shower" had a pitiful excuse of a shower which was just a drain in the bathroom floor with a shower curtain hung on the ceiling. It seemed dirty in there and I knew that if I had to shower I would be showering with my flip flops on. Considering all the free rooms avaliable, it amazed me that the lady had chosen to put us facing the construction workers which meant we couldn't open our window all the way (as they were working right outside it) and since there was no A/C it was ridiculously hot in there. My boyfriend and I decided to just lie on the beds and read/play cards until we were hungry enough for dinner (we arrived in the evening but had ate on the train). I was wearing shorts (while he was wearing jeans) and about an hour after lying on the bed my legs started getting bites and became incredibly itchy. The bedsheets seemed to have bed bugs or something on them so we left to go get something to eat while we waited for our travel agency to open in Canada. We went down the marble (at least I think it was marble) staircase and I was shocked to see cigarette butts on the ground. The hotel has obviously had no upkeep as it could be a great hotel with some TLC. My boyfriend decided he needed something to drink and after having the machine eat 4 euros, we went to complain to the receptionist. As soon as we started trying to tell her the machine was broken and if there was any way to get our money back, she 'couldn't speak English.' The receptionist who spoke PERFECT English to us earlier. We ended up leaving frustrated and cranky, and once we got a hold of our travel agent they did wonders for us --- they are still trying to refund the 4 remaining nights we had there but they found us a hotel that for the same price but was amazing (it had A/C, TV, a phone, clean sheets, and a bath tub! Yipee :P ) When checking out, the (now man) receptionist asked us if there was anything wrong. My boyfriend just said it wasn't up to our standards but I figured it there are bugs in the room that they need to be sprayed so as I was saying that I had gotten bit all over my legs from lying on the bed he rudely said that "if I have a reason to complain then I can come back and see him tomorrow" --- As if I was coming back tomorrow! Overall the location may be good but the staff is unfriendly, the rooms are filthy and the hotel is falling apart.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality/price - very basic, noisy and good location”
Reviews.Author: Gsoros
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights at the hotel. Room was very small and basic, but sheets were clean and bathroom OK. Very noisy at night because of many groups of students. Breakfast very basic, but OK. All in all value for money with pretty good location near to Termini and 1 km to Colosseum. Security seems OK with cameras. Found a digi-camera in drawer from a previous guest - returned it at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sxy_angel87
Reviews.Content: I think that the hotel must have been improved since these reviews as this hotel was more then satisfactory. Cheap and in a brilliant location. Room had what you needed considering your in Rome so shouldnt really be spending too much time stuck in your hotel room! Was clean, hot shower, staff were friendly and in a brilliant location near to termini station! We will defintly be using this place again :)

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous, do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jinisu
Reviews.Content: We booked through a local travel agent, but this place is totally appalling. In short, it stank, was noisy, furniture was broken, but most of all, it was unsafe. The bricks around the door frame were loose - it had obviously been broken in to before. There's no air conditioning of any description, but we dared not open the windows due to security issues. The lobby area is shared with another 'hotel' located on other floors of the building and featured some suspicious characters. The shower (calling it a "shower" is being nice) was a serious of undirected single spurts of water coming out at different directions! Needless to say, we couldn't sleep that night and left the next morning. We called our travel agent to tell them about this appalling experience and they (the agent) gave us a refund for the second night - I'm not sure if the hotel would have given the agent a refund, but somehow I doubt it. For the same price (130 euro) we moved to a much better place called Hotel Aberdeen, which was nearby (also close to Termini station).

Reviews.Title: “Sucked beyond all belief”
Reviews.Author: swingvxn
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us staying in the room. We were at the front of the hotel with NO AIR CONDITIONING on a street where apparently no one sleeps, ever. There were cable cars going by and vespas at all hours. It was impossible to sleep. We requested to be moved to a room at the back of the hotel which was infinitely quieter. It was still a dive. The bathroom was tiny and the "shower curtain" was more trouble than help. The bathroom floor flooded. I had read other reviews before I left (unfortunately too late to change my hotel) and had brought towels from home which were a lifesaver. You had to be in by 1 am or they would lock you out of the hotel. Breakfast was a joke of hard rolls and coffee. If you want any kind of concierge service whatsoever, do not stay there. Basically do not stay there unless you are looking for a hostel because essentially, that is what it is.

Reviews.Title: “DEN”
Reviews.Author: Antonis2
Reviews.Content: terrible experience in that dirty thing i am really surprised how this thing is called hotel extremely dirty rooms no tv no air condition the towels were pieces of bed sheet toilets not cleaned most of the rooms are located on a very very noisy street and as you can understand during night we could not close our eyes........ gosh, it was completely unacceptable........terrible terrible..........be aware of the photos you see on the websites...........the rooms are not that fancy.......watch out guys out there.......terrible pay a little more and get what you deserve for yourselves............the place you live on your vacation is something that will follow you when you think of a place you visit.............unfortunately for me and my friends we talk about the terrific roma and we get nervous when we think of this damned staying at this thing.............

Reviews.Title: “Acropli could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE have just returned from a lovely week in Rome, to be fair when we booked the hotel we were struggling for accommodation and all reviews read were not favourable. Clean towels were not available unless asked for, rubbish bins were emptied and left in the room. the shower has no curtain and flooded the floor. could have been cleaner. I wouldn't stay again but it wouldn't put us of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Acropoli is a dump!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from spending 4 nights in Rome at thia hotel. First impressions wern't bad as the lobby area was quite quaint. After spending a considerable amount of time trying to find the place, our room was not ready. We arrived at 12.30pm! We then had to put our cases in the dining area (which everybody does whether leaving or arriving) and go and find something to do for an hour til it was ready. When we did get in it, it was very depressing. There were twin beds for my husband and I and a single for my daughter. They were clean. But the furniture was old, tatty and very dusty. The wardrobe was not too clean inside either. The shower was old looking but clean and servicable but the water went all over the floor tiles and was very dangerous. The walls looked as though they hadnt been painted in decades and the floor looked as though that hadnt been hoovered for weeks. The curtains wouldnt have looked out of place in a D.S.S hostel (believe me, I've seen them!) and when my husband tried to open them, the pole fell down on him! There was only one mirror and that was in the shower room so we had to keep moving it to the nearest working plug socket every morning so me and my 14 year old daughter could get ready to go out. There were no pictures on the walls, no TV, no tea/coffee facilities. The walls are really thin and you can hear everything going on in the other rooms. It is very shabby. The continental breakfast was a joke. A bread roll, a portion of butter and jam and these packs of Bertonni biscuit things which were more like french toasts. Nice for a start but soon gets really boring. The choice of beverage at breakfast was chocolate, coffee, tea or milk which was actually ok. The staff arn't very friendly. The road the hotel is on is VERY NOISY every night. The italians just sit there and beep their car horns all day! We never got much sleep at all. I did do this holiday on the cheap as we didnt intend on spending much time at the hotel, we were going to use it as a base but as the weather was not at its best for a couple of days we did end up spending longer than we had anticipated in the room. I will not be doing anything on the cheap again. Just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom is really bad, rooms to small!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at Hotel Acropoli for one week in the last week of April. It was a schooltrip. We were with 5 persons and we had the largest room. Others, whit 4 persons, slept on a 2-persons room!!!! In the bathroom there was missing a shower-curtain, towels and the water is flooding. The most of the beds were ok, and the reception was the most beautiful thing of this hotel! So don't go to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel Ive seen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DONT GO THERE!! This is the worst hotel where I stayed worldwide. Walls are yellow of oldness, beds are for kids. During my stay I had NO HOT WATER !!!!! and sometimes no water and electricity at all. Perhaps it is a not so expensive hotel but the price dont fit with the rooms. AVOID THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Acropoli - A different view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews I read on Hotel Acropoli here before I went there I was not sure what to expect on arrival. I was afraid I would find a noisy and dirty hotel. Luckily I had a good time in this hotel. There was indeed a number of large groups of students or schoolkids when we were there. It was sometimes noisy in the evening, but never at night/after 11pm. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we did not have streetnoise. Sure, the hotel looks a bit old and shabby, but the sheets were clean, beds were made every day, there was a big window in the room, and most importantly: the bathroom was clean and the shower was fine. Okay, the bathroom floor was wet after showering (but we asked an extra towel and dried the floor with it), and yes, breakfast was not too much (but that is the Italian breakfast: coffee and some small piece of bread, at least you had something in your stomach at the start of the day), no, there was no tv or telephone in the room.. BUT, it is a cheap hotel and the location is great, so what else do you want? All hotels in Rome are expensive, so i think this is a good deal. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, proper and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kimm21
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cheapest hotels in Rome, so we didn't expect much, but it was great. It is very very close to Termini station and very close to the Old Centre, with the Colloseum etc. Every night we walked in about 20 minutes to the Trevi fountain and it was very safe. The hotel staff is very friendly and are very willingly to give information. There is an elevator, but its very cramped, only 4 persons can fit in it, but if you're lucky, like us, you'll get a room on the first floor. The hotel shares its facilities with the hotel next to it, but this doesn't cause any troubles. The room was very comfortable with airconditioning and a small but proper bathroom. I do think the room could have been slightly cleaner, though it is cleaned every day. It was rather disappointing that you can't have any alcohol inside the hotel, they are really strict about this. The breakfast was very simple and it was not a lot, but I guess that something you have to accept when paying so little. What I thought was a plus point, is that they have fending machines in the hall with soda, coffee and tea for only 50 cents. We were very pleased with this hotel and would stay there again when going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “I agree with that Francisco - it is a dump! Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Aug 04, having booked ahead. As a single female traveller, I requested an all-female dorm. When I got there I discovered that it was mixed, although the only guys left that day - the Hotel staff tried to justify putting me in there, by stating that they wouldn't put anyone else in there ... lo' and behold, 2 other people (gypsies) came in during the night. As for the room, it was carpeted (which, in baking Summer-Rome, is asking for trouble!), was littered with rubbish and stunk of sweat. The room looked over the main street (just around the corner from the station) so I spent most of the night trying to block out the fumes/noise of the traffic; it was either that, or suffocate in the room. I am not new to Rome: I have lived there in the past - I can honestly say that I have never experienced anywhere like this on my travels. Like the other reviewer, I too left the next day and found somewhere much nicer not far from that area. AVOID ACROPOLI!

Reviews.Title: “Location near Termini Station is good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated near Railwaystation Termini, on the "right" side of all the main attractions. My wife, 2 children and I stayed in Acropoli for 3 nights in Oct. 2004. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a 2 star hotel so the beds, bathroom, breakfast etc. are basic. But what do you expect when you pay 390 Euro's for 3 nights in a quadruple room in the centre of Rome? By the way: We booked directly by e-mail and NOT via internetsites like Octopustravel. It saved us 60 to 90 Euro's!! We slept at the back of the hotel, so it was quiet enough. But a few floors above us were students who made a lot of noise during the last night... However they do have camera's on each floor to see what's happening.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Acropoli
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 63-67, 00185 Rome, Italy
